div1.p: Legation of the United States of America.
I have the honor to transmit to you herewith, a copy of a letter received by this Legation from one Gustav Zobel, Sergeant of Company G. of the 3rd United States infantry.

It would appear from his letter that he has the intention to make application to enter the Service of the Independent State of the Congo, on the expiration of the term of his present military enlistment next February.
I should esteem it a great favor, if you could kindly assist me in furnishing any information to the writer of the letter in question, on the subject of his enquiry.
div1.fw:
Mr Edmond Van Eetvelde
Administrator General of the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Independent State of the Congo
div1.p: Thanking you in advance, I equally avail myself of the occasion, Mr Administrator General, to renew to you the assurances of my most distinguished consideration.

To the Secretary of the American Legation
Brussels, Belgium.

I am at present a Sergeant in the army of the United States and my term of service expires February 19th 1887, when I am thinking of making application for a position in the service of the Congo free State.

I shall consider myself greatly indebted to you, if you will kindly furnish me information, how to proceed, and when I shall have to go, to make application. I have been given to misunderstand, that the Congo State is governed from Brussels with His Majesty the King of Belgium as President; that is my motive in
writing to you for the information desired. I expect to be in Brussels four months from this date, and if I am posted, it will save me time and trouble and money. I need only add, that I speak english and german, have served in the german Field Artillery at Danzig from 74 to 78 have visited the Ordnance School at Berlin from 76 to 77 and shall have a first class discharge and the best of references from my present superior officers

I am Sir
Your obedient Servant.
Gustav Zobel
Sergeant Co. "G" 3d Infantry
Fort Shaw, M.T.
